item.title: Genshin Impact Is Upgrading Its Battle Pass in Version 6.0
item.description:
Genshin Impact is further upgrading its Battle Pass in Version 6.0, allowing players to skip the hassle of collecting Local Specialties to ascend their characters. The Battle Pass in Genshin Impact is considered great value when pitted against its pricey Genesis Crystal packs. It grants players bountiful amounts of Mora, Sanctifying Essence, and Hero's Wit – but most importantly, it also provides them with an extra 8 Intertwined Wishes per Battle Pass.

The Battle Pass in Genshin Impact appears quite different as it enters Version 6.0 compared to its state in Version 5.0. Players can not only choose their reward plan, but the Premium track is littered with new items, such as the Dust of Enlightenment and the Sanctifying Elixir. The former allows players to re-roll their Artifacts in Genshin Impact , while the latter enables them to craft their own. However, Version 6.0 is set to add even more value to the Battle Pass for those who purchase the Gnostic Hymn for $9.99.

Genshin Impact: Gnostic Hymn Value in Version 6.0

  • 680 Primogems
  • 1 Dust of Enlightenment
  • 1 Sanctifying Elixir
  • 4 Intertwined Fate
  • 5 Fragile Resin
  • 7 Guides of a Journey
  • 2 Philosophies of a Journey
  • 1 Battle Pass Weapon
  • 15 Local Specialty
  • 1,620,000 Mora
  • 159 Hero's Wit
  • 324 Mystic Enhancement Ore
  • 45 Sanctifying Essence

The information comes from the beta for Version 6.0 via Kuroo, featuring a video detailing the Battle Pass and its new reward. Specifically, Level 3 of the paid Battle Pass now grants Genshin Impact players a choice of any Local Specialty, with the reward box containing 15 of the selected material. Given that it takes 48 hours for Local Specialties to respawn in Genshin Impact , having an extra 15 to work with can make a huge difference – especially for difficult-to-obtain specialties such as Scarabs, Sakura Blooms, and Violetgrass.

The Gnostic Hymn is largely valued for its convenience, as it showers the player with a multitude of materials and resources. However, the Battle Pass weapons in Genshin Impact are exclusive to the Gnostic Hymn, and many of them are well worth the price tag. Serpent Spine and Wolf-Fang are especially beloved, and scale decently well with refinement levels.

In many ways, the Song of the Welkin Moon feels like a soft rebranding of Genshin Impact as a whole, with HoYoverse continuing to make bolder choices in presentation and design. It remains to be seen whether this philosophy will extend to gameplay as well, but the further enrichment of the Battle Pass will no doubt be welcomed by Genshin Impact players. Fans will be able to find out more via Genshin Impact 's panel at Gamescom or during the next Special Program Announcement. Version 6.0 is set to launch on September 10, 2025.

item.title: Mafia: The Old Country Is Off to a Modest Start
item.description:
Mafia: The Old Country is now available on PC and consoles, with several early indicators suggesting it's off to a modest start relative to the standards set by its predecessors. While it is too soon for accurate break-even estimates, the game appears to be tracking behind at least one previous entry in the Mafia franchise.

First announced in August 2024, Mafia: The Old Country was released for the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC on August 8, 2025. The Hangar 13-developed game currently holds a "Strong" rating on OpenCritic, with an average score of 77 and a 72% recommendation rate. While it has received praise for its production values and return to the tight, story-driven format of the original entry in the franchise, some reviewers have also criticized Mafia: The Old Country for playing it too safe at times, thus lacking the novelty of its predecessors.

Mafia: The Old Country Tracking Behind Mafia 3 in PC Player Data

Following its Friday launch, The Old Country peaked at 35,247 concurrent Steam players on Saturday, August 9, according to data scraped by SteamDB. This puts it well behind the third mainline installment in the Mafia franchise, which reached just under 48,000 concurrent users on Valve's storefront back in 2016. As of the late afternoon hours (ET) on August 9, The Old Country ranked third on Steam’s Top Sellers list by total product-related revenue, only behind Counter-Strike 2 and Battlefield 6 . However, its position may be reflective of the somewhat quiet release period of the year as much as the commercial performance of the game itself.

Mafia Games' Concurrent Steam Player Records

Game

Steam Conc. Player Peak

35,247

77

How Many Units Could Have Mafia: The Old Country Sold By Now?

According to an average of estimates from Gamalytic and PlayTracker, the Steam version of Mafia: The Old Country sold approximately 186,000 copies in its first 36 hours on the market. Moreover, a May 2025 study by GameDiscoverCo suggests that "reasonably performing" games tend to sell about 20 times their concurrent user peak on Valve's storefront in their first week. This would imply potential week-one Steam sales of up to 700,000 units, though that projection appears optimistic if the game sold only one-quarter of that total during its crucial first few days on the market. For clarity, single-player game sales tend to be front-loaded, at least when it comes to single-player, non-RPG titles.

According to recent publisher testimonies, PC users account for up to half of modern AAA game sales, depending on the genre. For a single-player, story-driven game like Mafia: The Old Country , the PC share is likely closer to 33%. With Steam being the only current PC storefront for the game, it represents the entirety of its present PC market. Another relevant data point is the number of PlayStation Store user reviews for Mafia: The Old Country , which currently stands at 4,000, less than 10% of Mafia 3 ’s total (the Steam review ratio for the two titles is comparable). Even assuming an optimistic review-to-sales ratio of 0.01, this would imply about 400,000 PlayStation sales. The Xbox version has fewer than 300 reviews as of August 9.

Overall, the game’s total sales appear to be below the 1 million mark, a relatively small figure for a series recently confirmed to have surpassed 35 million sales. Given Mafia: The Old Country 's modest price and assuming a flat 30% platform fee (which can be slightly lower on Steam for high-volume sales), the title would need to sell 1.76 million copies to generate $60 million in revenue. Whether that would be enough to break even remains unclear. With 2K yet to disclose the game’s exact development timeline beyond saying it was already in the works in 2022, not even its salary expenses can be estimated with precision, to say nothing of outsourcing and marketing costs. Be that as it may, available data suggests Mafia: The Old Country is off to a modest start.

Sources: Gamalytic, PlayTracker​​​​​

item.title: Battlefield 6 Has Already Beaten Call of Duty in One Aspect
item.description:
On the back of a highly impressive public beta launch, Battlefield 6 has touched a new peak concurrent player count of more than 521,000 on Steam, which is significantly higher than that of any Call of Duty game ever released on the storefront. This gives major bragging rights to Battlefield over its eternal rival franchise, instilling big hopes for a fruitful comeback of the series later in 2025, with Battlefield 6 .

Earlier today, on August 9, EA finally kicked off Battlefield 6 's highly awaited open beta access, leading to hundreds of thousands of players swarming to the game within hours. As a consequence, it easily raced past Battlefield 2042's open beta peak concurrent player count of 156,000 Steam users, and became the top release in the franchise, by far, based on this metric. With the ongoing open beta phase scheduled to take place through August 10, Battlefield 6 appears to be racking up more players and breaking notable engagement records every few hours.

Battlefield 6 Open Beta Draws More Engagement on Steam Than Any Call of Duty Game Ever

  • Battlefield 6 Peak Concurrent Players on Steam: 521,079
  • Call of Duty Peak Concurrent Players on Steam: 491,670

In another record-shattering feat, Battlefield 6 reached 521,079 peak concurrent players on Steam alone, beating the respective tally of each Call of Duty game by a good margin. More precisely, the upcoming military shooter stormed past the 491,000 mark, which is the highest peak concurrent players recorded for any game in Activision's highly popular shooter series till now. Interestingly, this accomplishment arrived a full two months ahead of the game's launch, scheduled for October 10. At the time of writing, Battlefield 6 is also the third "Most Played" game on Valve's platform, behind only live-service giants, namely Counter-Strike 2 and Dota 2 .

Keeping in mind that around half a million players are currently in the game on Steam alone, it may be fair to assume the new Battlefield entry has had over a million people tune in to the open beta across PC, PlayStation, and Xbox. Such an immense player turnout, even before the game's official launch, could be a sign of a return to form for the military action IP after Battlefield 2042 's underwhelming performance. In case that happens, Call of Duty may finally have serious competition in the genre this year, regardless of what Activision's recent comments may suggest.

It's worth noting that the numbers achieved during open beta do not necessarily translate to even bigger numbers at launch. This was seen in the case of Battlefield 2042 , which hit a peak of 156K players during open beta but only reached 107K players after rolling out. Therefore, it will be intriguing to see how Battlefield 6 's player engagement takes shape throughout its two open beta phases and then again at launch. If the ongoing discussion around the game is anything to go by, things seem to be on the up for EA's FPS franchise.

item.title: Persona 3 Reload: All Linked Episode Dates and Rewards
item.description:
Persona 3 Reload adds a lot of content that was not in the original game, with one of the more noticeable additions being Linked Episodes. While Persona 3 Portable added the female protagonist route that included Social Links with the male party members, it was not possible to experience these social links as the male protagonist.

While not full social links, each of the male party members in Reload has Linked Episodes. Each character has five Linked Episodes that build on one another and need to be completed on the one day they are available; otherwise, any further episodes with that character will disappear.

Updated on August 9th, 2025 by Joshua Leeds: Takaya doesn't have linked episodes like all the other characters in this article, but he does have meet-ups with the protagonist that are new to Persona 3 Reload. These meetups are mostly on rails, but there is one that is completely missable if you don't know where to go and on what day. This article has been updated to include that information to help players know when he meets up with the protagonist, and how not to miss this hidden meet-up when the time comes.

Can You Miss Linked Episodes in Persona 3 Reload

Unlike Social Links, Linked Episodes can be missed, and should one rank is missed, any future ranks won't appear on their later dates. That being said, some Linked Episodes are more lenient than others. Koromaru, for instance, gives players most of the game to complete his ranks, with new ones being unlocked on the latter-mentioned dates. However, missing a hangout will still leave it available in the coming days.

Linked Episodes with Akihiko are much less forgiving and are only available on the day they are unlocked and never available again. Linked Episodes should always take priority over any other use of time to ensure they are never missed, as other Social Links can be completed later without issue. Should a recent Linked Episode be missed, the Rewind feature can be used to go back and make sure it's completed before the deadline.

Every Takaya Linked Episode in Persona 3 Reload

Most of these Linked Episodes are on rails and can't be missed; the first few happen on the following days:

  • 8/14 Evening
  • 8/20 Evening
  • 9/18 After School

This final episode is missable, and requires players to go to Club Escapade on 1/16 or 1/17 in the evening . You'll be approached by a suspicious man upon entering, and after talking with him, you can find him in the back left corner under the stairs. Talk to him again, and he will lead you to the "messiah". This activity doesn't take any time and doesn't offer any reward, but it will very slightly change the dialogue between Takaya and the Protagonist during their final meetup.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Details Quality-of-Life Updates in Version 3.5
item.description:
Honkai: Star Rail is officially sharing the suite of quality-of-life changes coming to the game with the release of the Version 3.5 update, including some notable new features. The massively popular sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse is coming off one of the game's biggest updates yet, with the long-awaited debut of its first in-game crossover. Version 3.4 introduced the Fate/Stay Night collaboration to Honkai: Star Rail , with both Archer and Saber becoming playable characters. Now, the next update is set to bring plenty of nice changes as well.

HoYoverse is looking to follow up its big crossover patch with lots on the way for fans of Honkai: Star Rail . Version 3.5 will introduce two new five-star characters to the playable roster, with both Hysilens and Cerydra set to make their playable debut. The update will also feature the next chapter of the game's "Trailblaze Mission," a new location coming to Star Rail , and re-runs of both Kafka and Silver Wolf throughout the patch. Honkai: Star Rail is now giving a rundown of a plethora of quality-of-life changes coming during Version 3.5.

Honkai: Star Rail officially revealed the lineup of quality-of-life changes coming to the game with the game's newest "Update Radio" post. Star Rail 's newest patch will add a new system allowing players to toggle the voice lines for Saber and Archer to use the original Japanese audio at all times. The update will add several other smaller fixes, including merging Wishful Resin into Self-Modeling Resin, adding a "Smart Equip" function for Relics, and protection limits for buying Light Cones. Storage space will also see a notable change, with players able to delete older, completed Honkai: Star Rail quests to free up space on their devices.

Honkai: Star Rail Details Version 3.5 Quality-of-Life Updates

  • Adds the ability to toggle Archer and Saber to use voicelines from Fate/Stay Night: Unlimited Blade Works
  • Wishful Resin will be merged with Self-Modeling Resin, with the latter now able to customize both Main Stats and Sub-Stats
  • Players can now change individual Relics when using the "Smart Equip" system to equip a character's Relics
  • Adds a limit to the number of Light Cones a player can exchange at one time, to prevent over-exchanging for Light Cones.
  • The PC version now allows players to delete resources used for completed missions, while the mobile version will automatically exclude data for completed missions.

The changes coming to Honkai: Star Rail offer a wide range of helpful fixes for the game's playerbase. Combining Wishful and Self-Modeling Resin will simplify the process of crafting Honkai: Star Rail Relics, with players even able to get recommendations on Relic stats based on a character. The ability to delete the data for old quests will also be a major boon to players with limited device storage, allowing them to cull older quests they have already completed.

With a wide array of changes on the way, players won't have to wait much longer to dive into Version 3.5. Honkai: Star Rail 's next patch is scheduled to officially launch next week, with the update adding a brand-new farming and cooking event with "Chrysos Maze Grand Restaurant." HoYoverse has also begun to tease Honkai: Star Rail 's next endgame game mode, with "Anomaly Arbitration" launching as a unique three-team combat challenge in Version 3.6. Honkai: Star Rail fans should have plenty to look forward to during Version 3.5 and beyond.

Board the Astral Express and roam the universe in search of myths and legends. From global interactive entertainment brand HoYoverse comes a new space fantasy RPG. Harness the spirirt of the Trailblaze in a cel-shaded space fantasy adventure where you'll embark on an unforgettable intergalactic odyssey. You and your fellow Astral Express passengers will hop from world to world, resolve conflicts, form friendships and uncover a wealth of mysteries. In this exciting new free-to-play game, you'll journey through immense worlds of the unknown and bond with a series of memorable characters. Choose your companions and arrange the ultimate four-person combat team to help you take down a looming threat to the universe.
